body: I love this app, I like that I don't have to pay for it until 15 weeks as someone who has suffered a miscarriage before this pregnancy, I would hate to have paid for it and then lost the baby. It's common knowledge that the risk of having a miscarriage goes down after the first trimester so the people complaining about it being a lite version should take that into consideration. My only complaint is that the app tells me I'm 12 weeks 1 day pregnant when I'm actually 12 weeks 2 days pregnant but then it also tells me I have 27 weeks and 5 days left so what happened to the 7th day? Maybe just a bug that needs to be fixed. Overall great app , can't wait to purchase the full version in a couple weeks!

title: Exactly App I Was Looking For
body: Very helpful for a first-timer. All the posts seem to fall at the precise time they're most needed.

title: Perfect
body: This app is great for first time moms. My parents and my in-laws live in different states as do all our siblings and family, so this up was very helpful for me as I didn't have people close by to ask questions or get advice. I love discovering the size of baby each week, the weight tracker, and the pictures. So far the app has been on point with info and advice and always seems to come right when I am experiencing it for myself - it's great. The only thing I wish was better was once the second trimester starts the baby pictures are harder to see.. Whether they are blurry or zoomed in, is rather see a full "picture" of what the baby might look like at this stage instead of just the hand or up close face.

title: DO NOT DOWNLOAD!!!!!!!
body: Over all, I like this app BUT it waited until I was 28 weeks pregnant to tell me that the free trial period was up and I had to pay $3.99 for the full version. If I would have known that, I would have done it 28 weeks ago. Now it's like I'm forced to buy it and I won't be using it after the baby comes so why waste $4 for a few more weeks of use? I'm promptly deleting it just on principal. Not fair guys! Some apps I've had on my phone for years and actually get some use out of. Those apps were not even close to $4. This app is just a glorified ticker if you don't have the full app. At 14 weeks it also stops showing you images of the actual size of your baby. It also stops giving you updates on your baby. Your better off downloading "What to expect when your expecting" app or "baby center" app, which are born FREE! I don't mind paying for apps, but I want to be able to use them, so this one is a waste.

title: Love this App!!!!
body: Always helpful!! I love reading about the little one in me and the formation is always great with details and explanations. Haven't noticed any problems and I have used this app through two of my four pregnancies. I love it! I love the pictures, the info and the alerts its sends me every weeks updating me on my progress. Def recommend to others if they are looking for a reliable and accurate app for pregnancies!! Thank you!!

title: Very impressed with 4th pregnancy
body: I'm pregnant with my fourth baby I do like what to expect and baby center as well, as those are what I have used in previous pregnancies but I am still learning new things every day. This app has a lot of very useful information as well as interactive tools and fun too. I love watching the slide show of the growing fetus turn into a baby it is very realistic and this app also allows you to track your progress like many other but I will be able to look back at my journey farther down the road and remember the smaller details I will soon forget. It's like an informational journal with interactive tools. I have the pro version and am very pleased with my purchase. The name finder is also fun.

title: Great... But not if you miscarry
body: I love this app! It's very user friendly and has a ton of info not just on your babies development but it also includes blogs, and facts on everything from where you're at in your current state of pregnancy. My one complaint however, is that I miscarried about three weeks ago. To my surprise there was an option to put you miscarried but I am still getting notifications every week telling me I am "8 weeks pregnant" and so on. I know I could just delete the app and call it good but we're trying for another and I'm wanting to use it again. It's kind of like salt to the wound with every week seeing how far along I would have been. I have even restarted the app but I am still getting these notifications every week.  Developers... If you could fix this I would very happily give you 5 stars :)

title: Great app!
body: At the beginning of my pregnancy I added a bunch of apps to follow along week to week. This is the only app that I kept...and well worth the small amount of money! It shows you week to week in a detailed description how you your baby should be developing. As and added bonus there is a small daily blog to address experiences you will have, answering questions that you will wonder about along the way! Also included are weekly size charts, contraction monitoring, calendars for your weight and appointments, places to add notes and pictures to track during your pregnancy and more! I really began looking at this on a regular basis and will be purchasing the next app for my babies first year! I highly recommend!

title: The only pregnancy app you'll need!
body: I love how easy this app is to use and how helpful the information. My favorite features are the images, timeline, question list for health care providers, shopping checklists and size chart.

title: Lame
body: The tone of most passages is similar to "What to Expect When You're Expecting," thus, expect a lot of cliches about male and female approaches to pregnancy.

title: Great app
body: I was looking for an app that doesn't require you to register with an email address. If I wanted a bunch of crap coming into my inbox I wouldn't buy an app, I'd subscribe to an enewsletter. This one fits the bill and has really awesome graphics. It also doesn't have a ton of useless info and features like some of the others (this is my second pregnancy so I know what info is most important). I show the images to my daughter each week and she loves learning about her growing brother or sister. The only downside is that it's not really free-after you are 14 weeks you have to do the in-app purchase to keep getting new content. Still, I'd rather pay the $4 then use a free app that floods my inbox with emails and offers.

title: This app is amazing but PLEASE ADD A CALENDAR
body: I love this app everything about it is amazing but the only thing I beg the creators to add, is a calendar & with the calendar show you how many months you've completed & how much more you have go, like whatever's completed those days are highlighted or something and whatever if left have like some cute symbol or whatever next to the number, it would make it so much better instead of me having to go to the calendar in my phone. PELASS CONSIDER THIS. I love this app and it's totally worth the money just please consider adding that feature, I know a lot of mothers like myself would appreciate it .

title: Love It
body: This is my second pregnancy and I wanted something different. I didn't have access to apps last time so enjoyed hunting around for a good one. We had the free version for awhile before my husband upgraded it for me. I thought the to do list and shopping list were amusing and fairly handy but since I'm having a home birth, the hospital bag option was useless. It was also confusing at first to figure out how the contraction timer worked. But it was fun overall. My two yr. loves looking at the weekly pictures of the baby and watching the progression video. Biology crash course, right? üòâ

title: It was a good app until....
body: I downloaded this app when I found out I was pregnant, which was at about 5 weeks. So I've had this for a little while, and it's such a great app for pregnant women to have. The images of what a 2D, 3D ultrasound would look like at whatever point you're at in your pregnancy, even an animated look which I thought was amazing. It was very informative about what to expect, what symptoms you would be having at the time, etc. BUT, once you get closer to 15 weeks, they start showing you less things unless you pay for it, and by week 15 you can't see ANYTHING. I thought this was extremely unfair! I can't stand apps that force you to pay for it, especially now in this situation where all I wanna do is watch my baby grow and be informed as well as I have been for the passed 10 weeks. Sorry, but 2 stars for this stupidity.

title: Upgrade
body: This was by far my favorite app to use during the beginning of my pregnancy but once I reached 15 weeks I have to upgrade to be able to see any new weekly information, including the ultrasound pictures they provide each week. I haven't been able to find another app that I like as much as this one and I'm disappointed. This app needs to be completely free. We already have a lot to pay for when the baby gets here, don't make us pay for an app on a phone that we won't keep forever. On the other hand, it isn't too expensive and I was very unhappy with all of the other apps I tried because none of them were as detailed as this one. I love this app and will use it for my next pregnancy as well.

title: Great app!
body: I used this app from 6 weeks and on. I'm a 1st time mom so it was specially exciting for me to read about the changes my baby and I were going through. I like the baby ultrasounds, the fruit/baby size comparison, but my favorite part was the "partner's advice". My husband looked forward to resin the weekly updates on baby and I and the partner info really helped him understand what his roll was and how he could be involved and helpful. The descriptions under "your body" were 90% accurate and I would find myself laughing because it was exactly what I was going through that week. Thank you!

title: Excellent app; worth the fee after 14 weeks
body: I'm kind of annoyed that people give this app poor reviews because full features are only unlocked for free through week 14.  It tells you that in advance. And don't be cheap people.  I'm about to get pregnant again and my original 2.99 has gone a long long way and now will guide me through a new baby.  The information in this app is beyond tracking weight and weekly bump pictures which I loved) and fetus size updates.  There are helpful guides, time-appropriate short articles and reminders along the way, so it was well worth it for me.

title: Worth the purchase!!
body: I NEVER purchase anything on app's, however this ONE time I did. I couldn't find a pregnancy app that would show me visually along the way how much my baby would change week to week, that's what initially sold me, which is awesome. I love all the other features as well! It tracks ur weight, baby, ur belly photos, size and weight of baby, articles regarding concerns, questions, and things to expect, shows time frames of each month, and waaay more. I'm now in my last month of pregnancy and still very pleased with this app!! Highly recommend the purchase to continue throughout ur entire pregnancy!! Love, love, love it!!!

title: Favorite Preggo App
body: This is my favorite app for obtaining information regarding the status of my pregnancy, baby's development, and my body. I love that they make an effort to include the partner as well in the week-by-week discussion. Of all the information I have at my fingertips, I make sure to share the weekly updates from this app with my husband so he can read about and see baby's development. I also love the illustrated anatomical images of the fetus, as well as the user-generated 2D and 3D scans at each week. Lastly, the link to the makers' blog with a rich wealth of information, is a wonderful added bonus.

title: Charged twice and the app still doesn't work!
body: First off, the app somehow allows you to make an in-app purchase without creating an account for authorization. After creating the account it doesn't sync any information or remember that you made a purchase, therefore misleading you to purchase it again on another device. Their FAQ  states "As long as you sign into the same App Store account you used to purchase the Pregnancy App the first time, you will never have to pay twice. Under the ‚ÄòBuy the App‚Äô button there‚Äôs a ‚ÄòRestore your purchase‚Äô link."

title: This app is a MUST
body: If you are looking for an app that you can grow with day by day....this is it. This app is a way to look at your baby week by week and see how it's changing. It also has information that changes daily in a variety of topics, weight tracker, important information for drs apts, blogs to read and discuss things on, and it gives you so much more options. (TOO many to list) the only option I don't like is to continue using the app you have to pay 3.99$ after 15wks. If your further along than that you can't see anything. TOTALY worth it though.....üòç

title: Misleading
body: This application is decent, I found some information to be different than that which is on other sites. Regardless, when you get up to your second trimester, the require you to pay. I find that to be so misleading and pathetic, because you download these apps unaware of this fact, and then you are used to getting weekly or daily updates, and all of the sudden you feel kind of pressured to update.  Honestly, it's just not a way I would have ran an app. I would have much rather had fans of the app appreciate and appreciate the resources they have been given thus far, and then switch it up. I noticed I'm not the only one who thinks so. Anyone who doesn't agree must have a tendency to waste money or must work for the app. Regardless it's not about the $4 it's about the principal.

title: Best Pregnancy App
body: I downloaded all of the major pregnancy apps and have been using all of them. Now almost halfway through my pregnancy, I can say without a doubt that this is the best one. The weekly and daily information is great (not all apps have something new for you every day). The weight tracker is the easiest to use of all the apps. Has important functions like contraction counter and kick counter, and some bonuses that are really useful like the baby name list (you can search or add your own), list managers, birth plan, and various guides that provide useful information.

title: Perfect for following the day by day
body: If you like to have something new to read everyday and have an app that organizes your pregnancy, this is for you. You can keep track of your appointments, new baby shopping items to keep track what you have and what you need, and you can even track contractions when you get to that point. You can browse possible names and bookmark them as you are deciding, see images comparable to your baby's growth, and even store pictures of your belly growth to review your timeline over the months. Lots of neat features.

title: My favorite pregnancy app!
body: I downloaded 3 other pregnancy apps before I found this one. This is by far the best one in my opinion. It is easy to navigate and has all the info I was looking for. It includes illustrations as well as actual ultrasound pics weekly plus tells you the average length and weight of your baby week by week. It has the fruit/vegetable comparison which I like as well. Lots of helpful tabs to click with useful information.  You can enter your own info and pics as well.  I deleted all the other apps and just use this one exclusively now.

title: Excellent App! Best App!
body: I absolutely love this pregnancy app. I had three apps & this is my favorite! The images are remarkable because they are very realistic. I love that you can see the development week by week through 2D & 3D images. The week by week information provided was very detailed. All of these things made me feel more connected to my son when he was gestating. I utilized the appointment section, weight tracking, hospital bag check list, birth plan, and name suggestion sections. One of my favorite tools was the kick counter. Even my 6 year old daughter had fun using the kick counter.

title: I love this app!
body: I use this app every single day! Yes, I did pay the $3.99 for the full version. But, seeing as I get on the app every day it seemed like money well spent. I love tracking my weeks & see what my baby looks like each month! I love putting in all my information & love the feature that allows you to upload your sonograms. I can go to one place & see all my babies pictures. Yes, I'm aware I could just look at my phones photo log, but something about it being on this app makes it much more special. I haven't had one issue with the app since I purchased it.
response: Thanks for the great review - we're working hard to make the best pregnancy app!

title: Love this App
body: I used this App for all 3 of my pregnancies. It's such a great tool to track baby's growth and development. I found the checklists very helpful (especially for my first) and enjoyed reading the weekly updates about what baby was up to and the changes my body was going through. My toddlers also loved following along with the size chart and would often ask what fruit is the baby now? It was fun to show them pics too of the baby as it would be developing in the uterus. Great App for me and my family enjoyed it too! Highly recommend especially for first time Mums.

title: Awesome Pregnancy App
body: This app is very helpful and interesting, they always have something new to read each day. I really like how it has how many weeks you have left, a description of your growing baby, and how it you lets you keep track of upcoming appointments, etc. This app has so many features it's just an overall awesome pregnancy app. I definitely recommend this one, you won't be disappointed. (It's like 4 something dollars for some reason but that might of included taxes. Its worth it though with all that's included in it and the accuracy of it.)

title: So exciting!
body: I loved this app. It was so informative! I looked forward to reading every day the different fun facts about my baby and my body. Each week my husband and I would look forward to reading about what major change was happening. I loved the section specifically for the       " partner" because it really helped for them to know what the pregnant woman was really going through. I loved being able to see the pics of what my developing baby may look like and I also enjoyed the belly growth picture as well. I absolutely recommend this app to any pregnant woman!

title: Great app!
body: Loved using this app throughout my pregnancy. The only issue I had was the descriptions of what is happening with baby often change from using "he" or "she" to "it." My baby is not an "it."  Also towards the end weeks the daily blog seems to skip back to earlier topics and even took me to "week 16" when I was in the final month. The constant warning messages that pop up during contraction timer usage were annoying. Other than these editing issues I found the app to be very user friendly and include all my needs.

title: Loved this app!!
body: I got this app in week 6 of my pregnancy and it seemed great, so I purchased it before the trial even ran out.. I used it up until the very last day before my baby was born!! It is great. I love the tips and information, the weight tracker, and the name list. I used this app to pack my hospital bags and make sure my nursery was ready for my little one's arrival. From beginning to end, this app was useful for my entire pregnancy. I don't even want to delete it even though I'm not using it anymore. Might just keep it around to look at from time to time. :)

title: Great app just missing one thing
body: I love this app! It is a great way to keep my family involved in the progress of how the baby is growing and changing each week. My youngest loves the baby size timeline where it compares the baby size to food, while my husband reads all the milestone details. All the tools like doctor appts and baby needs listed are awesome. The one thing I wish this app had was an ability to change the baby's birthday without effecting the due date timeline. We are having a C-section and it would be nice to be able to put that in without messing up the timing of everything that proceeds it

title: Used this app the whole pregnancy, worth paying for.
body: I'm not one who ever pays for apps, so when I saw this was $3.99 I wasn't too thrilled. But I figured I would try it after reading all of the reviews, and I'm so glad I did! By far the most useful, informative, and resourceful pregnancy app out there. I downloaded all of the other competitor apps, and ended up deleting all of them. This app has been my go to app for my whole pregnancy, I look at it multiple times a week (and I'm 39 weeks now!!) Id definitely recommend this to anyone who's pregnant, worth the money for sure.

title: All the info you need in one app
body: Of the 5 apps that I have been using, this is the best by far. Yes, I know 5 apps...overkill haha...just excited to learn everything that's happening in there. Each week the app tells you about the baby, your body, multiples, health tips and there is a section for partners. It was spot on with all my symptoms and questions at each stage. I love the daily articles/topics, the timeline guide, the appointments section, the to do list section...the app has everything you need to get prepared and be organized. I would recommend to everyone.

title: My favorite pregnancy app!
body: This app is my far my favorite. I bought all the little add ons and I love them. The photos in this app are definitely the best of all the apps I've tried. I love that I can see a 2D and 3D ultrasound of what real babies at this stage look like. And the animated graphic for each week is beautiful and happy.  And the weekly updates are great! There's so many features on it that I can get all the info I want in one place which is great. I would definitely recommend this app to anyone looking for the perfect pregnancy companion! By far the best one out there.

title: Love this app
body: My daughter became pregnant and I have always talked to her about pregnancy and what not. I wanted to find a app that can help her threw her pregnancy and keep track of everything she goes threw and we both love this app so much there's things that it teaches you that I never knew with having my five kids it's one amazing app that is for sure. We both love reading the blogs and all the information that it gives us about the size of the baby and all that, we recommend it to everyone we know who becomes pregnant it is so worth it for sure..

title: Love it
body: The app is great. I look forward to reading about what is happening inside of me during a particular week. I think it's very informative. I especially love seeing the pics of the side view of a pregnant woman and seeing how big the baby should be inside of your belly that month. I sometimes jump ahead to see what I have to look forward to. :) I did catch a typo on today's info though

title: 5 weeks pregnant
body: I got this app when I suspected that I may be pregnant put in my lmp and it told me a due date and how far I was. I then when to the doctor a week later and they told me I was 5 weeks pregnant just like the app told me. I also love it show and gives detail about what's going on with me and my baby. Not saying that you shouldn't go to the doctor because that is key but this app tells you the very same thing your doctor would. I highly recommend this app to any women who is expecting. I loveeee ittt... üòç

title: Recommended app!!
body: I had another pregnancy app but their daily tidbits didn't coordinate with the pregnancy timeline so at 19 weeks I started looking for another app. I tried about 8 others including this one. I love the daily tidbits and the weekly updates are very detailed. There's a lot of extra features with this app. This is my 2nd pregnancy and I read several books with the first, and I enjoy reading a out health and our bodies so I found this one to be accurate and up to date. I would highly recommend this app!!! Worth the money!!!!

title: Could be better
body: First off, I find it annoying that they want a weekly check in for weight. Second, the pictures have been trimmed since last update, so bottom of weekly pics are simply cut off. Another thing I noticed, is that the pictures seem to be in disorder, especially in the 2nd and 3rd trimester. For example, week 29 you have what seems to be a developed baby, then the pictures for week 30 and 31 are of an under developed baby. Then all of a sudden, go to the next week (32), and you have a plump baby. Week 34 and 35 also seems out of place. Week 27 is a terrible picture where you don't see the head at all.

title: Best one out there
body: I downloaded 2 or 3 other pregnancy apps 2 of which are really popular out there and I ended up deleting them and keeping this one. This app has so much more to offer than the other apps I added originally especially if you purchase the additional features. Happy mommy app hunting!

title: Awesome App
body: I love this app, it's better than most I've tried and bought. Love the pictures. After multiple miscarriages, ectopic pregnancy where I lost a tube, 2 failed fertility cycles my husband and I decided to adopt. 3 weeks after our sons adoption we got pregnant on our own. I am almost 11 weeks (longest pregnancy we've ever had) and everything is going on target per not only my OB but this app as well so I can see the point of the app being free until 13 weeks. You just never know what can happen. I plan on buying this app then.

title: A MUST BUY!!
body: This is my first pregnancy, so of course I downloaded any and all pregnancy apps I could find that looked interesting and useful. I rummaged through all of them and deleted all of them but this one. I keep up-to-date with how far along I am and I look forward to different articles it reveals to me each day. I write all the questions i have and bring my ipad with me to each doctors appointment. I find it extremely useful and worth the small amount of money it costs to access everything it has to offer. :)

title: Mama of 2 & one on the way
body: I love this app. It's so amazing how it tells you so much about your beautiful blessing growing  in side your belly. And it gives you great tips on how to take good care of you & baby. If I have another baby after this one I would use this app again. I've even recommended this to my sis who is also pregnant. She's  just 2 weeks apart from me. It's also nice to be able to show my daughter & nieces what the baby looks like & the size the baby is. I recommend this app to any one who is expecting.

title: Pretty stellar
body: I think this app is great; it has everything an expecting mother needs. I haven't done a search for anything, so I'm just now realizing that I've never bothered to check for a "search" icon, but all relevant information pertaining to pregnancy is in there.

title: Great.... But.
body: This app is amazing. By far has the most information and love the format and layout. But I have to pay to get full use? It's hard to find good information and apps that give good insight to a pregnancy like this app. But I'm not paying to "unlock all features". I'll just google or find another app. I understand a person/company needs to make money for their hard work and what not but I'm just not feeling the vibe that I get when I think of paying an app to help me better understand my own pregnancy and get peace of mind. But again, it's a great app information wise.

title: The best Pregnancy App
body: I am a mother to 5 children and started using this app with my last two as my other kids wanted to be involved and informed with everything that had to do with the babies. This app provide with very interesting information which is easy to understand even for children, specially the comparison between the growing baby and the fruits, I recommend this app to all expecting parents specially the ones that have children at home asking questions about the new baby to come.

title: Enjoyed weekly progress report
body: The primary reason I purchased this app was to see pictures and read about my baby's development. It certainly has delivered on that objective. It's fun to read about what's next. It's also easier to hand this app over to my husband (versus a book) when he's curious. Possibly would have been more inclined to use other features if I had downloaded app at beginning of my pregnancy. Definitely would recommend this app to other expectant moms.

title: Love this app!!
body: I love being able to track our daughters growth and developments! It's amazing to see weekly progress. Reading the daily blog also helps reassure both parents that what we are going through is normal (as normal as a pregnant woman can be)! My husband and I have lost several pregnancies, I appreciated that we didn't have to pay until past 14 weeks. It's a small thing, but it gave me something to look forward to being able to purchase the full version. I would recommend this to any new or veteran parents!

title: My go to resource
body: I don't write reviews typically, but I thought this app was worth reviewing. I tried other apps, but this is the one I came to on a regular basis. It's been my companion from the start. One of my favorite features is the weekly overview of the pregnancy. Very informative to follow along with the baby's development, your body and helpful partner info. I was able to keep my family and partner involved from week to week by sending them the updates. I highly recommend purchasing this app!!

title: Best pregnancy app I have come across
body: Wow! Love this app! So helpful and informative. Love the shopping lists, and all the preparation tools. Every morning I wake up and read about exactly where I am in my pregnancy, look forward to it every morning! I think that this app has everything you need and is WAY more efficient then the others I have downloaded. The only thing I don't quite understand is why this app says the baby is so much smaller than other apps.

title: Loving it!!!
body: This is my 2nd pregnancy but this baby would be my 1st live baby should I be so blessed to go all the way! This app has been a great companion throughout the first few weeks of my pregnancy and great way to share my pregnancy with my family! It's informative and tracks everything! I could even add my own belly pic which it's awesome! Love how it keeps me on track n I can rely on it to record important details and reminder and even my pregnancy journal! It's super! I recommend it 100 and 1000%!

title: Love it!!!
body: This app has been amazing throughout my entire pregnancy. I'm currently 32 weeks and I love that it tells me something new everyday because it seems that everything in the blogs is what I've been experiencing so great to read what they have to say and it also shows me what our baby is compared to which is great for parents with older kids as well so they can see and feel like they're a part of the pregnancy as well. I would recommend this app to anybody pregnant. (:

title: Happily paid $3.99
body: I happily paid the $3.99 to unlock the full app. I think it was generous of the developer to even offer the first trimester for FREE. This app is amazing. I'm all for compensating people for their hard work, and it is very clear to me, just by looking at this--there was a lot of time, effort, and care that went into creating this app.

title: Beautiful app...but...
body: The app is very well set. The pictures are realistic looking. It's a very nice app, however, I downloaded my app last week, didn't use it for two days over the weekend, and when I went to log in today, it said my email did not match an account with the app. I know for a fact I made an account with my email. I even tried resetting my password and it still told me my email didn't exist with an account. Being that I just found out I'm pregnant, I just created a new account. Hopefully, it works now.

title: Great app.
body: Was disappointed that after a certain amount of weeks you had to pay for it to get anything else... But after paying for the full app it was so totally worth it. It kept lots of information that I put down. Name ideas, etc. kept track of my appointments. By far the best pregnancy app. It gives the option to reset it for when you have another one, but I don't even want to lol. This will be my first baby & she means to world to me. Thank you for this great app.

title: Wish it were free!
body: Some of the baby pictures they have are duplicates. Which seems a little lame to me to show the same picture six weeks later as if the baby hasn't changed at all.
response: Thanks for the great review - we will share your comments with our development team regarding the images. Feedback from customers like you helps us to keep improving the App!

title: Great graphics, okay information
body: This app has the most life-like graphic interpretations of a growing fetus, which is great. It also has a lot of interesting tools. The information, however, is a little biased and unreasearched. For instance, there is no actual proof that what you eat changes the flavor of your amniotic fluid, so don't tell me that my baby will "taste" everything I eat. Also, don't tell me that I should "expect interventions during labor, such as pitocin or a C-section." Interventions can be almost always be avoided, so I don't appreciate an app telling me that I should expect these changes to my birth plan.

title: Great app worth the money
body: I really enjoy this app it has everything I could need all in one place. Very informative. This is my second pregnancy and my 6 year old loves to see the pictures of baby developing week by week. Worth paying the few dollars for the upgrade. My only concern is that it is a week ahead. I'm 5weeks 6 days and from the beginning of week 5 it's been giving me week 6 updates and so on but other then that I'm very happy with it!

title: Great app
body: This is my third pregnancy, didn't really think I'd need an app. But I sure am glad I got this one. The info, sonograms, baby name lists, etc. are all great. But my favorite feature is the timeline. It's really great to have all that information laid out in such a user-friendly and easy to see at a glance format. For all this and countless features I neglected to mention, I recommend everyone who is expecting to cough up the few dollars for the full version of this app.

title: Must have app for pregnancy!
body: This awesome app was the first thing I looked at every morning of my pregnancy for the great daily articles that always seemed applicable to my current questions or concerns based on how far along I was. It was the absolute best pregnancy app I downloaded, and I downloaded a lot of apps! Totally worth the money for the information, the pictures, and the timeline that shows you the progress and milestones you hit based on your personal due date.

title: Best app EVER!!! <3  (MS)
body: This app is absolutely amazing. I'm so happy I came across it. It gives you every bit of information you need plus more. I always keep my appointments in there and keep track of my weight at every appointment. I would recommend this app to every pregnant woman!! It really teaches you a lot.. Who cares if you have to pay $3.99 after 14 weeks pregnant. I'm 14 weeks and 4 days now and I'm deff going to purchase it right away.. It's way way worth the $3.99.. Best $3.99 I've EVER spent:)

title: Great pregnancy app
body: I've loved this app throughout my pregnancy. I've enjoyed the weekly updates. The information is always informative and helpful. Other helpful features: timeline of events throughout your pregnancy (ultrasounds, first kicks, tests), helps you track appts and weight progress. Overall I've enjoyed this app. You do have to play around w it at first to fully understand its features as it's not as intuitive as I would like but after that it's great.

title: Awesome For Mom's to Be
body: I just downloaded this app, and I'm already loving it. As a first time mom-to-be, I love being able to see weekly pictures of fetal development, getting daily updates related to prenatal health and having the ability to track all things baby in one convenient place. The ability to add photos, count kicks, track weight and add doctors appointments is a great addition and adds a personal touch to this app. It's a one-stop-shop for mommies!

title: Excellent app to use throughout your pregnancy!
body: I am a NEW Dad and I used this app to help me with the different stages of pregnancy that my wife was going through during her pregnancy. I began using this right from the beginning. Yes, you will have to pay for this down the road but it is truly helpful and educational. It is totally worth the $3.99. The weekly articles are the best and was looking forward to reading the updates every Monday morning. I highly recommend this app!

title: Pregnancy
body: Love this app! After playing around with several pregnancy apps. This one has all I need, want and more! It has everything in one so I don't need 4 different apps. This is our second pregnancy using this app. I also love that they considered Multiples (we had twins first pregnancy; single this pregnancy), Partners info which i send straight over to my husband to read, and what to pack for Hospital. Used the contraction timer during labor. Excellent all the way. Highly recommend it!

title: Jerome and Quiriat
body: This app has been like a "Family Member" the past 37 weeks. With all of the questions, anxiety, joy and excitement, every week this app has added value and increased comfort throughout this process. It almost feels sad knowing we won't be opening the app any longer, but I feel we will be back in a couple more years. Thank you for all the great information and helping us guide our way to bringing in new life.
response: It‚Äôs really nice to receive such lovely feedback.  Thank you so much! We‚Äôre working hard to make the best pregnancy App!

title: Pregnancy app
body: I love this app. It has a perfect balance of everything in it. I have three small boys who love to see pictures of how the baby looks each week and also a fruit comparison for how big the baby is. It tells you what tests you will be doing at the doctor on a time line and info on the baby and things for mom to expect as well. It even tells the babies horoscope for birth. Every day it up dates with tips and how far along you are.

title: I adore this app!
body: This has given me a lot of insight on what to be expecting during these past few months, with this being my first child, I didn't have a clue what to ask doctors at OB Appointments, or what items to be looking for for the nursery. The pregnancy books are so mind numbingly tedious, and your OB usually has you in and out of your appointments in 5 minutes or less, it's great having this app to fall back on for information, and I love the new design! So cute!! üíû

title: Lots of features, wish I could turn some off.
body: This app has a ton of cool features and is very informative. You will find the occasional grammatical error but for the most part it is very refined. My issue with the app is there is a lot of focus on weight gain and there is a feature that includes showing a practically nude model for tummy sizing. It would be nice to be able to turn features off, as these ones in my case would upset my wife.

title: Beautiful!
body: The images are great, I love seeing what the baby looks like in the womb as well as ultrasound images of each week. It's been fun to share with my other two children the size the baby is that week, compared to fruits we have in the house. It gives them something to compare the baby's size to. I find the appointment calendar so convenient too. Wish I had this app for my previous two pregnancies as well.

title: Love this app
body: My husband and I love this app. When I found out I was pregnant I downloaded every baby app because I wanted to know what was going on with my baby. This app is the only one that I liked and was easy to understand! We enjoy finding out our baby's milestones every week and it helps with a lot of questions so I am not blowing up my doctors phone! I highly recommend this app and I will definitely use it again in future pregnancies.

title: Best pregnancy app
body: This app has everything! I love being able to show my family what the baby should look like, and how the baby is positioned inside of me. They help you with your birth plan and what you'll need to prepare for the baby and its nursery. They show you what you actually need instead of what people get extra that just make stores money. It makes me even more excited for my baby to get here and it satisfies my need to plan ahead!

title: Best Pregnancy App in my book!
body: Used thus throughout my first pregnancy and it's great! Totally worth the money after the first trimester! #1 best thing about the app is that many of us wonder what baby looks like! Every week this app shows what baby would look like on ultrasound and on 3D or 4D! I also like being able to record my belly size every month and the scale chart for weight as well as daily updates and not just weekly ones! Thank you!!

title: Just one thing bothers me....
body: I can't share absolutely anything to Facebook. It's an amazing app and I've been jumping back and forth to a couple, I'm 20 weeks and I'm sticking with this one but I would really appreciate if you could make it so I can share to Facebook to keep my long distant family up to date. Other than that it's a beautiful app with so much on there. I'm sticking with this and The Bump. Thank you! Please fix the bug!! üòä

title: Love this app!
body: Hey! I've been using this app since I found out I was expecting my 4th baby, I'm 29 weeks along & love the features that this app has, the advice, the countdown, the alerts it sends with new info every new week that goes by. I especially love the video & pictures so I can share with my kids how big the baby is & what she kinda looks like at each week. Thanks for supplying such a wonderful app for us mamas to be!

title: Expecting Dads
body: This app is simply amazing. Not only has this informed me more about the cycle of pregnancy and it has let me experience following week by week the approximate growth of my child. ( ex. They use veggies and fruits to show you how big the baby is.) there are very helpful articles about what symptoms you might be experiencing and why. Also there are many articles about staying active and fit throughout your or your partners pregnancy! Exceptional App!
response: It‚Äôs really nice to receive such lovely feedback.  Thank you so much! We‚Äôre working hard to make the best pregnancy App!

title: A lifesaver!
body: This app was truly a lifesaver to a couple of clueless, first-time parents. I purchased 3 other apps, but this one was the best, by far! My husband and I started every Sunday by reading our weekly update. The daily reminders were timed perfectly, and the related blog entries were helpful also. We used all of the features on the app - names, hospital packing list, kick counter, contraction timer, dr appts, weight tracker, and others! It was worth every penny!

title: Love this app!!!!
body: I would definitely recommend this app to any pregnant woman. It is so helpful and offers a lot of information. I love the fact that it shows me what my baby looks like in the womb, I only wish the photo that they use wasn't so zoomed in. As I get further a long the picture gets bigger. I would like it better if I got to see the whole baby not just the face. Other than that, this app is amazing!!!

title: Love!!!
body: This is my favorite pregnancy app. On my second pregnancy now and I wish I'd had it for my first. It's simple to use, uncluttered, and the animations of baby are incredible! I also love that there are actual sonogram photos week by week. I love the daily/weekly info and the option for journaling. Didn't think I'd use that part, but some days, ya just need a place to write down symptoms or feelings or cravings. Must have for all soon-to-be mamas!

title: Worth the money
body: I rarely purchase the upgraded version of apps but I made an exception for this one. This app is way more user friendly than a lot of the other pregnancy apps and it had some cool features like sonogram pictures and drawings.

title: Good app but...
body: I really enjoyed this app until it made me have to pay. Which, I did at the 15 week mark. However, every time is says it will restore the app it doesn't and that I need to purchase the app. Then I try and re-purchase the app and it tells me that it's already been purchased and it will restore for free? Soooo, glitch? I would either like my money back or to have the app work!

title: Information without fluff
body: This app is very informative- as most of the pregnancy apps are.  However this one is just so much "cleaner" in its look and usability. The classy version of tracking your pregnancy. I love the weight tracker and the list builders. Also, the feature to write your birth plan makes it so easy by just ticking boxes, and it's so easy for others to read. Just simple bullets. No wordy paragraphs that annoy medical professionals anyway.

title: Wicked good App
body: My wife and I both loved this app. Being that this was our first baby we learned so much and looked forward to a new week passing, so we could read about what stage our baby was in and prepare accordingly. All the info matched up perfectly with what my NP mother would tell us so it's very accurate. We were hooked from week 1 all the way to week 37 and just welcomed our daughter yesterday. Wicked good app, good job guys.

title: Great app annoying last update
body: I love this app, I am 20 weeks pregnant and the app has helped me along with information, weight tracking, ideas for names, etc.

title: Excellent! Very informative!
body: I love having this app as every day I get new information on what my baby is developing, answers to why I'm feeling certain things and what I can expect in the upcoming days and weeks! It's awesome! The pictures of what the baby looks like each week is very cool! And I love the baby names section, how I can choose favorites and see them all on a list!

title: Super Good Advise!
body: I started on this app with the free trial and was impressed with the accuracy of the daily/weekly tips so I purchased the full version. As a first time dad, this app helps me get a better understanding of what's going on with my girlfriend and what I should be expecting in the following weeks. Also, the pictures help fill the void of how the baby is developing between the actual sonogram appointments. Great app, I highly recommend it.
response: It‚Äôs really nice to receive such lovely feedback.  Thank you so much! We‚Äôre working hard to make the best pregnancy App!

title: Great app
body: With being a new mom, it's easy to get overwhelmed with all the changes that your body goes through and all the elements involved with pregnancy... This app is a great way to incorporate all the aspects of pregnancy into one convenient location. I particularly love that they have so many pictures: 2d and 3d ultrasound., the size of your baby, etc. there is a lot of helpful information on this app. I def recommend it !!!!!

title: An excellent app
body: I enjoy being able to keep track of my pregnancy and keep informed on the stages. It's been right on time with the info I needed when it happened. With four weeks left I can't wait to see what it will be able to do. So far I love keeping track of my bump pics weight and blood pressure as well as appointments. This is a great app for those who are first time moms and have a bit of pregnancy brain :-)

title: The BEST pregnancy app
body: This app is one of THE BEST pregnancy apps that I've come across. It provides you with awesome pictures of what the fetus looks like. It really makes you feel like you can actually see your baby growing inside you. All the blogs that it has provides you with really good information. I am excited to read all of the different content that it contains for each day of pregnancy. It was totally worth buying.

title: Best pregnancy App
body: I downloaded a few pregnancy apps before I found this one. The others just seemed to have to many promotional adds and didn't really provide a clear understanding as to what I was experiencing.

title: Unless you think your entitled
body: this app is worth every cent of the $3.99 I paid to unlock the 2nd & 3rd trimesters. All of this weekly and daily info, tips, incredible images, and more at the palm of my hand must have took someone a whole lot of time and effort to create. After all, would you work for boss for free? I didn't think so, because your time matters as much as the makers behind this app does. Rate the app itself- not your disappointed expectation for free things.

title: Neatest pregnancy app with LOTS of info!
body: Love love love the pictures of the baby week to week. I really like they show three different types of images too. Absolute love the info on baby, my body and partners. Favorite app!!

title: Lovely pregnancy companion
body: This app has given me the right amount of info at exactly the right times during my pregnancy. All the books have been too dense and overwhelming‚ÄîI'd much rather open the app and read a short, useful blog post or article! Great stuff! Could be improved by putting a share button on the blog posts and articles. Sometimes I'd like to share or save one and I can't. Thanks!

title: Locks you out by week 15 unless you pay
body: I liked this app in the beginning. It had good features like tracking your weight, descriptions of the baby and daily blogs (some helpful, some meh, some just wrong info). Then at my 14 week mark little padlock icons started showing up blocking the screen with "if you want to continue, please pay to unlock the rest of the app!" By week 15 the entire app (except the home page) is locked unless you pay. In order for sites to demand that you pay they've got to be pretty darn good, this is not one of them that is worth paying for. Deleted it, go with Ovia, whole thing is free.

title: Enough with the nagging!
body: I paid to unlock the full app. I don't want to sign up for an account. No means NO. Why is paying for the app not enough for these people?

title: Absolutely love this app!
body: I'm on baby number two and have used this app for both! It's so informative and encouraging. I love all the pictures and the "what to expect this week" info. It's all so helpful and it's exciting following along to see how your baby is. I tell all my pregnant friends about this app. I wish it was the first one to come up when you search for pregnancy apps in the App Store. Should be!! Love it!!!

title: Very Informative App!!!
body: This app has a lot of information, especially if you're a first time mom. You can store your appointments, weight, and other information within this app. It also inform you one what not to eat, suggestions of what to eat, shows the growth progress of your baby, etc. Will most likely purchase the app at the end of the free trail; which gets you through you first trimester.

title: This is by far my favorite pregnancy app!
body: This app has it all in one place, from kick counters to baby names to shopping lists to informative daily tips. I check this everyday and find it an exciting way to keep track of everything that's going on. You can change the setting that displays one week ahead or the the actual week of pregnancy in the settings. All in all great app.

title: Great app!
body: Very helpful app that has great information! I just wish it had more information because since this is my frat pregnancy I have read ahead a few weeks so then each day I don't have new information to read pertaining to that day or week.

title: Best pregnancy app I have ever used!
body: This app is very specific and informative. It has so many extras that you wouldn't expect, including a detailed baby name section that has a great selection, I fact, I've only used this app for baby names suggestions! It has so many features! I HIGHLY recommend this app to anyone who is trying to conceive or is already pregnant. The full version is worth the money.

title: Favorite Pregnancy App
body: I downloaded several pregnancy apps when I found out I was pregnant. This one was my favorite, I even deleted the others. It has a daily blog, weekly report of what's happening with your baby and your body, lots of great pics, etc. I installed it on my husbands phone and it makes it easy for him to understand what's going on with both me and baby. Highly recommended!

title: Pretty App
body: This is a very pretty app. I downloaded it and unfortunately had a miscarriage. I downloaded it again when I thought I had conceived again.

title: Download this app now!!!
body: This is my first pregnancy and this app has been so helpful already. I am only 6 weeks along and so far have learned so much, I enjoy checking it throughout the day to receive tips and look thru the many photos of how my baby is developing. I can't wait until I'm further along and can look back at the progress my bump has made. What a fun and informative app!

title: Best Pregnancy App Out There!
body: I used this app all throughout my pregnancy 8 months ago, and loved it so much! It's informative without being too much to read, or boring. I enjoyed waking up to read the daily things that were going on in my body, and liked comparing my babies size to the various fruits. I would definitely recommend this app, I've tried others and this one tops them all!

title: Simple and Helpful
body: I absolutely love this app. It has helpful information and it is enjoyable to use. I love looking at the images of the different stages and week of the baby. I definitely purchased it and check it everyday. The timeline and the daily information is useful. Also ever since week 28, I use it everyday to count the baby's kicks. I think it's a great pregnancy app to have!
response: It's lovely to read such a great review! We're working hard to make the best pregnancy app!

title: Very informative and helpful app
body: This app is very informative and helpful during my entire journey of pregnancy. The daily blog and tips usually comes before what my OB will tell me and prepare some basic knowledge and understanding of the pregnancy process.

title: Best we have found!
body: It has helped us a ton on what to expect and what we need to be doing as first time expectants. We like the way this is setup and how it breaks it down to individual weeks and days. It also has lots of little details that we had never even considered before. Other apps weren't as user friendly and put together as this one is. We will be buying the full app.

title: Enjoyable for 3rd Pregnancy
body: Really have liked keeping all of my pregnancy-related info in one place!  Weight, belly pics, potential names...  Very handy!  Then I can share or not share the information with those around me.  The little articles are great, as even with two down, I'm still learning or re-learning things about pregnancy!  I would definitely recommend!

title: Restricts you access after 14 weeks
body: I liked this app until once I hit 15 weeks, it shuts you out of all of the baby info and images! So I've been logging info on this app for the last 10 weeks and all of a sudden I have to pay $3.99 to continue reading about the baby or see images or tips on my eating habits etc. What an unpleasant surprise. The entire app should be free or throughout all 40 weeks OR the charge should've been required at download from day 1 Bc now I'm wondering if they charge you AGAIN at your 3rd trimester? Pretty stupid.

title: Must have for pregnant Moms!
body: I loved this app! Everyday I used it to see where I was day to day in my pregnancy. I enjoyed reading all the extra daily articles within the app. Being a single mom this app kept pushing me along and I didn't feel so alone. I have 1 week left and can't wait to meet my baby girl! Completely worth the $3.99 one time fee to use! Love, love, love this app! Highly recommend!!

title: Awesome!
body: I got this app when I found out I was pregnant, paid for it when I hit 14 weeks and have used it since. It's really great! My 6 year old LOVES Being able to see what her baby brother looks like (more or less) each week, and often asks me if she can see what the baby looks like right now. The information is also awesome, but it's really the images that sell the app. Love it!

title: Good pregnancy app!!
body: This is my second time to use this app and I still love it. The pictures are amazing and it also has a lot of good information on the baby. The attached articles I usually read unless it's one I've seen before or it doesn't pertain to me. The appointment part really helps you keep up with dates and information. I definitely recommend this app to anyone.

title: Amazing app
body: I love this app. I just have a suggestion. I have read hundreds of awesome articles but I would like to be able to refer back to some of them sometimes so my suggestion would be adding a search bar so I can find the article or have a place in articles that you can 'star' it or 'favorite' it and be able to refer back that way. Thanks for all the knowledge!

title: Awesome
body: I love this app! I have used it for almost my entire pregnancy. While I didn't use all the features I found the weight tracker, kick counter, and contraction timer so helpful! The new pictures every week are a nice bonus. I also like that they give you places to upload your own pictures and write notes. I've never had any problems with this app. Love it!

title: Love it!!
body: This app along with Your Pregnancy Week-by-Week book or What to Expect When Expecting really eased a lot of worry and wonder about what's going on inside. My family has even been shocked to hear how much is known about an unborn child compared to when they were having children. Everything throughout this app is extremely helpful and convenient.

title: Love it but
body: This app is absolutely amazing! But i wish I could share to Facebook AND I wish it would tell only the IMPORTANT things to have in the hospital bags. I bought all kinds of stuff that I don't even need to take with me when I go into labor. It's my first pregnancy so I have no clue what I need and was told I don't need more than half the crap i already bought üôÑ just made me spend money for nothing. Other then little things like that it's a good app.

title: Love, love, love
body: I absolutely love this app! I wake up everyday and read my daily update on the app and I love reading the weekly updates as well! I also take advantage of the many organizational tools, such as the shopping list & packing list! Those features are great! I also like that I can record Dr. visits and track my weight! Overall, the app is fantastic and I would highly recommend it!!

title: Very helpful
body: Even though this is my third pregnancy, it's nice to have an explanation of what's going on or what to expect. I don't remember EVERYTHING about my first two. And I love all the helpful "reminders", appointments, important contacts...all of those things are nice to have easily accessible. I would have loved this app for my first two!! A lot easier than carrying around a bulky book!

title: Amazing info and stunning photos...
body: This has been the best app through my entire pregnancy. I installed it at our first positive test at a mere 9 days past ovulation. The information the app contains is above and beyond the typical pregnancy app. The images are stunning! Also, easy-to-use layout and so very user-friendly. Even my grandmother could use this app if she chose too. I love it. Thanks so much for an awesome app!

title: Beautiful and Informative!
body: Love love loved this app! It was such a helpful little app with all its beautiful pictures and helpful information. It's like this app could read my mind and would send daily advice and would always seem to answer things I wondered about in the back of my mind! I highly recommend this app to anyone that's expecting a new little blessing in their life.

title: Must have for pregnancy
body: I love love love this ap! I have tried lots of different ones, however this ap has been my most favorite! It has everything from daily counter, to weekly growth updates, blogs and so much more! It has been such a handy go to for pregnancy! I love opening it each day and reading the new articles it has! Must download this ap if you are expecting!

title: Absolutely love this app!
body: I'm currently 37 wks & 4 days pregnant & this app has helped my husband & I a GREAT deal. The layout is nice & I like how I'm able to see what the baby looks like throughout the weeks. Our 3 kids always ask "what size is the baby now?!" And they too look forward to pressing "play" to see how far the baby has come in size. The tips are always very helpful as well! Thank you!

title: Perfect for first babies!
body: This app is extremely useful and has tons of information that I as a new mom found reassuring. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed reading the daily updates and reviewing the tips and pieces of educational information.

title: I love it
body: Its an amazing app i love it!! The pictures are so real you can see how big your baby is......personally i dont like those cartoons pictures i like this ones because i feel like its the real deal!. I love reading how my baby is growing every week and they have great daily blog about what you should do and how to stay healthy i recomend this one!! It really helps you out a lot!

title: Good until 15 weeks
body: The app was great until I hit 15 weeks. It's advertised as free but after 14 weeks, the app requires you to upgrade/pay for any further info. It's easy to say "just pay the $4" which I would've done if it had cost that from the beginning but holding any further information over your head 'for a small fee' is pretty obnoxious. Luckily there's plenty of other app's that are actually free, you just have to take the time to download them. Wish I'd read the reviews more thoroughly in the beginning.

title: Love this app!
body: This app is visually appealing and everything is easy to locate and read.  I check it several times a week and my 6 year old daughter does too!  She loves seeing how big her little brother is and measuring his size in her hands.  It's a neat app.  I opted to purchase the extension for a few bucks so I can access the weeks beyond 15.  I think it was worth it. *2 thumbs up!*
response: How fun to share it with your daughter! It‚Äôs really nice to receive such lovely feedback.  Thank you so much! We‚Äôre working hard to make the best pregnancy App!

title: I'm Hooked!
body: I haven't had the chance to read to much of my pregnancy books, so i downloaded this app and check it on a daily basis! It only goes through the first 13 weeks of pregnancy but it is still very insightful and I'll definitely be purchasing the upgrade to get me through the rest of my pregnancy! I love all the tools, photos, and daily tips! Great app!!

title: Love it!!!!!
body: I had picked a few pregnancy tracker apps and used them for about two weeks. This app stood out amongst all of them. It's beautifully crafted, easy to use, and has many ways to keep track of your pregnancy. It offers many guides on various things such as exercizes, foods to eat and other ides for pregnancy. I highly recommend this app for new moms such as myself.

title: Best Pregnancy App
body: I downloaded several pregnancy apps but now that I'm in my second trimester this is the only one I'm still using. This is the only one that shows me the actual week I'm in. Great description what happens with baby and my body. Loved the size charts with fruit or vegetable. I'm only missing links to videos about babies development and marks on the timeline for 2nd and 3rd trimester.

title: Ssoooo helpful!
body: Wonderful app! Super helpful, informative blogs, and lovely pictures! I enjoy looking at this app everyday to see what new things are going on in there! :)

title: The best!
body: I loved having this app with me throughout my nine month journey. I love the information that was shared and the ways to keep track of my progress and appts. I wish there was an enhancement so I could enter my baby's birthday and we could continue tracking milestones through this next part of my journey. Thank you for being apart of such an important part of my life.

title: Disappointed!
body: I was really enjoying this app, very informative, the daily blog is great, imagining is really fun. However, it's been 8 days and my daily blog won't update. It tells me the current title of the blog, tells me my current weeks and days, the size is correct, but when I click on the blog it goes back to day 98 (which I am no longer there) same with my weekly description, I want to read about my current week, but when I click on it, it goes back to 14weeks, and prompts me to "upgrade" kind of disappointing!

title: Best pregnancy app I've had!
body: This app is seriously amazing! Totally worth the very few dollars. I am so glad I got it personally! I got it when I was 8 weeks and now I am 31 weeks! It's very helpful and does have amazing advice. I'm so grateful for it. This is coming for a FTM that hasn't doesn't enjoy apps that involve reading. I actually look forward to reading the next day and week!

title: Great app
body: I'm enjoying this app more than some of the others. The little timeline is slightly outdated. Gender can be determined as early as 10 or 11 weeks now and Doppler heartbeat can be found much earlier than the timeline states. I thought it was odd that the info hadn't been updated yet. Also, some other tests that aren't included on the timeline or they just aren't placed accurately.

title: Just as Great the 2nd time Around!
body: We used your app with our 1st, and now we are 2 weeks away with our 2nd üôåüèº I absolutely love this app and recommend it to my friends and patients. My sister has used and loved it as well. (We're due a week apart!!) Very easy to navigate. Informative without being 'pushy' on controversial topics. And I love the weight graph, and weekly size chart.

title: Needs to be twin pregnancy friendly
body: I love this app. It's really great. But it needs to be twin pregnancy friendly (or multiple). People are having twins or multiple babies lately it's only right that we embrace them too.
response: Wow - twins! How exciting. Many of the Daily and Weekly entries in the Baby section of the App have information for mothers of multiples. In addition, you can set the App to recognize that you're having twins in your Pregnancy & Due date settings. Hope this helps! We appreciate your feedback, though!

title: Fun at first
body: Kept me busy at first but went through the info pretty quick.  Planning tools (appointment scheduler and weight tracker etc) were handy though.  Overall, most of these apps are pretty redundant, filled with mostly generic "official" recommendations that I learned in high school biology.  I'm a microbiologist and physician assistant and so I suppose I am looking for something that digs a little deeper into the less obvious, and even addresses the controversial issues and science of what makes for the healthiest pregnancy.

title: Liked the app until the update
body: I BOUGHT this app because it didn't make me sign up or sign in with social media and now it asks me to do this EVERYTIME I launch the app. I paid for this and should be able to permanently decline this if I don't care about data synchronization.  Also, I used to be able to put in a weight with partial pounds and now it seems you can only do full pounds so that is not really an improvement. Please get rid of the sign in page. I like the content but I liked the app so much more before the update.

title: The best of pregnancy apps
body: My hubby and I dowloaded 4 apps as soon as we new we were expecting.

title: Two thumbs way up
body: I am 21 weeks pregnant and have been using this app sense I found out at 6 weeks I did purchase the full app well worth the money it's fun to watch and read each week how she is doing and when pregnancy brain kicks in its there to remind me of various things  supportive and informative when any situation arises it's the best mid wife there is!!

title: Won't stop asking me to restore
body: I really liked this app, I tried several and ended up with this one for the realistic photos that were wonderful to look at with my other children.  I loved the timeline and all the features which I felt were laid out lovely.  The only problem is that it won't stop asking me to restore after every other click.  I have tried restoring several times checked to see if I have the updated version and etc. I would delay buying this till the bugs are fixed.

title: Beautiful and organized
body: So many features with this app, yet it is not overwhelming because everything is so well organized. Not to mention the animation is beautiful. After downloading several pregnancy apps, I deleted all but this one. And unlike other free apps with a "+" edition, I don't feel like this app is incomplete unless I buy the other version.

title: Amazing!
body: I downloaded this app the moment I found out I was pregnant ! And honestly it is the best app!! I love the design and how it gives you so much information about the baby, how you may be feeling at a certain point, and also information for your spouse. It shows pictures of how your baby is growing week by week! I am absolutely in love! Best pregnancy app!

title: Please make this tiny change!!!
body: This app is amazing! I love it! I REALLY wish it would let you customize the lists: hospital bag, birth plan etc. It allows you to add your own but you can't delete anything, even the ones you add yourself. I would prefer to have the list exactly how I want it then check off the things once they are packed. That little change and I would give the app 5 stars for sure!

title: Best baby app out there
body: This happens to be the best baby app available. I am on my third child and the day by day things to help me get to know what's going is just fantastic. There is a lot I didn't know about pregnancy. Week by week is awesome as well, so if your pregnant or trying to be come pregnant I highly recommend this app. I don't know what I would do with out it.

title: Awesome app!
body: I had three other pregnancy apps, and deleted all but this one and one other one.

title: Great app!
body: Easy to use, informative and well organized. Out of the 3 pregnancy apps I downloaded this is the one I find myself coming back to daily.

title: Perfect app!
body: This app was nothing but amazing! I woke up every morning and the first thing I did was read what was new with the baby. I loved seeing the pictures and learning new things that were occurring that week. The contraction counter kept me from making unnecessary trips to the dr for false alarms. Highly recommend for everyone, whether its your first or your 10th!

title: üíóüçºüëº love this!
body: Amazing app. My sister is actually the pregnant one, but I wanted to follow along with her pregnancy because we currently live across the country from one another. This app allows you to customize the settings to choose if you are the mom, grandmother, aunt, etc!! It's awesome! It is full of useful information! The pictures are adorable.  Definitely worth downloading.

title: Great app for pregnant women
body: It really gives you important information you need to know about your pregnancy. Especially if it's your first time being pregnant like I was. I related to a lot of the blogs they posted and it gave me a lot of answers to questions that I had about pregnancy. Definitely recommend to other mommies who are welcoming a baby to the world.

title: Perfect App for new moms
body: This app has been extremely helpful.  Very worth paying for the upgrade. The daily info is great but the weekly information has been perfect, explains a lot of what is going on with your baby and your body. It has been great with keeping up with Dr. Appts, tracking weight, blood pressure, baby's heartbeat, etc. I highly recommend this app.

title: Not worth $3.99
body: This is my second pregnancy and I decided to go with this ap this time because of the simplicity and the pictures. I enjoyed it but did not feel it was worth having to pay after you get to week 14 when there are other apps that will take you through your whole pregnancy with as much or more information and the same amount of features. Bummed because it was great until week 15.

title: Only first trimester
body: I don't like how to see the 2nd and 3rd trimester you HAVE to pay $4. The first trimester is good to know about but once you get into the kicks and the all the time movement and not being able to hold your pee because the baby is pushing on your bladder women should be allowed that information too without having to pay for it here, we can get it free on the Internet, it's good for the first trimester.

title: Perfect App for Mom of Twins!!
body: My husband and I found this app exceptionally helpful. From the pictures, to the detailed info on the babies to tracking my weight to doctors appointments... This app did it all.  Week by week this app literally guided us through the entire pregnancy. This was the ONLY app that I found that provided info for mothers carrying more than one baby.

title: Great for siblings
body: Got the app for tracking but paid for the full version for all the pictures. It was so fun to show my 3yo pictures of "our baby" before it was born. Helped her to get through the mystic part of baby growing inside and she asked to see pictures of the baby often when we talked about her new brother or sister.

title: LOVE IT
body: I have checked this app every week since becoming pregnant.  I knew when I was 4 weeks pregnant and I am now 37 weeks.  I enjoyed watching my baby grow on the screen every week and the articles were all very informative.  I downloaded a bunch of pregnancy apps this pregnancy have deleted all of them except this one.  Highly recommended!
response: It‚Äôs lovely to read your positive review - we're glad you are finding the App useful!

title: Inaccurate :(
body: I am in 2nd trimester, so after comparing all the apps, I decided to buy this one. I went inside trial version to buy it and instead of updating, I had to enter everything over again. Then it changed my due date even though the LMP was the same. Not only that, the date on the trial version changed and the two versions don't even match even though they both have the same LMP. I'm so mad that I picked the one app to pay for that cares nothing about accurate information. Fix it, please!

title: ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
body: LOVE this app! It just updated yesterday and it's even better than before! I recommend paying for it! I love that I can email weekly updates to family. The update added a baby name finder! You can organize your favorite baby names. You won't be disappointed! I NEVER review apps. EVER! But if you're pregnant and looking for a good one, look no further!

title: Awesome prego app
body: This is the best, easiest to navigate simple app for pregnancy I bought the full version which helps you with what to bring to the hospital ect. And has even a dad list great job whoever made this app. Also they have captured the best pictures for not just inside belly pics but also the live video my 2 year old thinks he's really seeing what's in mommys belly. Great app

title: The best pregnancy app
body: I have learned so many amazing facts about pregnancy and child birth because of this excellent app. Also it's the only one that allows the parent to enter whether they are the mother or father. Full stars because of this feature. The pictures are incredibly detailed. I recommend purchasing this app for there are so many extras beyond the free version.

title: Wonderful App!!
body: I have really enjoyed using this app ever since I first found out I was pregnant. I love showing my DD pictures of the baby on here and it has helped her understand a little more about what's going on with momma! I really love it now that the update has made it so the blog is more appropriate for where I'm at in my pregnancy and enjoy using it everyday!

title: I love this app!
body: Not only is this app informative about the baby's growth and your stage of pregnancy but it also offers a lot more. Everyday there is a new blog posted about things every pregnant lady wants to know. Also everyday there is a little tip of the day to help you have a safe and healthy pregnancy. I highly recommend this app to any pregnancy woman not just first time moms!

title: Don't get too attached to this app...
body: I loved this app, and so did my family. We shared and updated with it. And then on day 99 (when my first trimester ended), the app quit letting me read info. Now I have to pay $4 for the full version. They tease you with the first trimester info, and then expect you to pay for stuff that was free the day before. Too many free and useful tools online and available through my OB for me to pay for an app that preys on the excitement of new moms. Shame on you for misleading and taking advantage of people who want information about their growing babies.

title: Expecting father
body: Has tons of info each week! I really enjoy reading the new info each day and better understanding what is happening and how things are progressing. It's funny because there will be times my wife will say, wow I really feel like my belly grew over night and sure enough there will be a post about exactly that!

title: Paid for features I didn't get
body: I paid for the full app because it said it would let me see info past 28 or so weeks, but it also promised tons of extra features. Paid for the full app, and didn't get one single extra feature. Rip off. Plus, it's pretty dumb that you have to choose baby names from their very limited list. You can't add your own to keep track of names you're actually thinking of using. Finally, half the daily blog posts are full of misinformation and are written not by healthcare professionals, but by first-time moms.

title: Five stars
body: I'm glad that I decided to get this app and pay the small fee to continue to use it. It keeps me up to date with everything, my weight, my appointments, my body and the baby. It also gives me daily blogs and information to read that helps along the way! This app is great to have during pregnancy!

title: Very Nice
body: This is a good pregnancy app. It has a lot of helpful tips, information, and I LOVE the internal images of the growing baby. The size guide is fun to share with hubby ("Baby is the size of an avocado this week!") and I like the email function of weekly updates too. Only complaint is that you have to pay to continue after 12 weeks. :-(

title: My favorite pregnancy app!
body: This app is by far my most favorite of all the pregnancy apps I have. I looked forward to reading the daily and weekly tidbits as the information was very helpful and interesting. Will definitely use this app again for my next pregnancy, and I've already told two friends to download this app as well! :)

title: Great helper App
